page.title: 18Wick Airport
page.content: Wick Airport is the most Northerly airport on the mainland of Scotland. It is owned and run by the C.A.A. It was a very important airport during the war but is very small now. It employs about 15 fulltime workers and 3 parttime workers. There are 2 airtraffic controllers, 2 telecomm- unications officers, 6 firemen and 1 office worker. Most of the passengers are on business trips as the airfares are expensive for private use.There are about 160 passengers a day adding up to 800 a week.Because the airport is so small there are not a lot of facilities but of course there is a waiting room.There are 24 incoming and outgoing flights a day,to go all over Scotland and sometimes to England.In summer some flights go to Denmark and Sweden with lobsters and clams.
